Passages.text:
Παλλάδʼ Ἀθηναίην ἐρυσίπτολιν ἄρχομʼ ἀείδειν,
δεινήν, ᾗ σὺν Ἄρηι μέλει πολεμήια ἔργα
περθόμεναί τε πόληες ἀϋτή τε πτόλεμοί τε,
καί τʼ ἐρρύσατο λαὸν ἰόντα τε νισσόμενόν τε.
χαῖρε, θεά, δὸς δʼ ἄμμι τύχην εὐδαιμονίην τε.
Passages.author: Unknown

Passages.text:
soles occidere et redire possunt:
nobis, cum semel occidit brevis lux,
nox est perpetua una dormienda.
Passages.author: Catullus

Passages.text:
...ἀντέγραψεν, εἰ τὰ καλὰ τοῦ βίου ἐγίγωσκες, ἀπέστης ἂν τῆς τῶν ἀλλοτρίων ἐπιθυμίας ἐμοὶ δὲ κρείττων ὁ ὑπὲρ τῆς Ἑλλάδος θάνατος τοῦ μοναρχεῖν τῶν ὁμοφύλων.

πάλιν δὲ τοῦ Ξέρξου γράψαντος, πέμψον

τὰ ὅπλα, ἀντέγραψε, μολὼν λαβέ.
Passages.author: Plutarch

Passages.text:
"O socii—neque enim ignari sumus ante malorum—
O passi graviora, dabit deus his quoque finem.
Vos et Scyllaeam rabiem penitusque sonantis
accestis scopulos, vos et Cyclopea saxa
experti: revocate animos, maestumque timorem
mittite: forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvabit.
Passages.author: Virgil

Passages.text: ἕτερος γὰρ αὐτὸς ὁ φίλος ἐστίν
Passages.author: Aristotle

Physicists.name: Isaac Newton
Physicists.desc: Known for establishing classical mechanics, his work on optics, and formulation of calculus.

Physicists.name: Stephen Hawking
Physicists.desc: Known for his study on cosmology and black holes, especially his discovery that black holes emit radiation (now known as Hawking radiation).

Physicists.name: Joseph-Louis Lagrange
Physicists.desc: Known for his work on classical mechanics and astronomy. Transformed Newtonian mechanics into a branch of analysis, Lagrangian mechanics.

Physicists.name: Daniel Bernoulli
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to mathematics and fluid mechanics. Laid the basis for the kinetic theory of gases. Formulated Bernoulli's principle.

Physicists.name: Leo Szilard
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to nuclear physics and biological sciences. Conceived of the nuclear chain reaction. The Einstein-Szilard letter led to the Manhattan Project.

Physicists.name: Galileo Galilei
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to classical mechanics (including his study of pendulums) and astronomy. Persecuted by the Catholic Church for his belief in helicentrism.

Physicists.name: Ernst Mach
Physicists.desc: Physicist and philosopher who contributed to the physics of shock waves. Mach's Principle was influential in the formation of general relativity by Einstein.

Physicists.name: Ludwig Boltzmann
Physicists.desc: Known for his development of statistical mechanics. Provided a definition of entropy using the Boltzmann constant which interpreted it as the statistical disorder in a system.

Physicists.name: Albert Einstein
Physicists.desc: Known for his theories of relativity, discovery of the photoelectric effect, and contributions to quantum mechanics.

Physicists.name: Joseph Fourier
Physicists.desc: Known for his development of the Fourier series, widely applicable to models of heat transfer and vibrations. The Fourier series eventually led to the Fourier transform and Fourier analysis.

Physicists.name: Pierre-Simon Laplace
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to mathematical physics and astronomy. Developed the Laplace equation and the Laplace transform. Predicted phenomena similar to black holes.

Physicists.name: J. Robert Oppenheimer
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to quantum mechanics and nuclear physics. Oversaw the Manhattan Project as its director, though later he strongly opposed nuclear proliferation.

Physicists.name: Max Planck
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the founders of quantum theory. Discovered that energy is quantized, and postulated the Planck constant.

Physicists.name: Wolfgang Pauli
Physicists.desc: One of the pioneers of quantum physics. Discovered the Pauli exclusion principle, for which he received a Nobel prize in 1945.

Physicists.name: Augustin-Jean Fresnel
Physicists.desc: Known for his many contributions to optics. Gave an explanation for diffraction patterns and the nature of polarization. His work led to the acceptance of the wave theory of light.

Physicists.name: Richard Feynman
Physicists.desc: Known for his work in quantum electrodynamics and particle physics. Developed Feynman diagrams to describe the behavior of subatomic particles.

Physicists.name: Chien-Shiung Wu
Physicists.desc: Contributed to nuclear and particle physics; known for her work in experimental physics. Discovered that parity is not conserved.

Physicists.name: Sadi Carnot
Physicists.desc: Known as the "father of thermodynamics." Developed the first successful theory for the maximum efficiency of heat engines. The Carnot cycle is named after him.

Physicists.name: James Clark Maxwell
Physicists.desc: Known for his work on electromagnetics, Maxwell's equations, and the Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution.

Physicists.name: Hermann Minkowski
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to the theory of general relativity. Developed "Minkowski spacetime," a mathematical description of space and time as a 4D space.

Physicists.name: Lord Kelvin
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to thermodynamics and electricity. Instrumental in the formulation of the 1st and 2nd laws of thermodynamics. The Kelvin unit is named after him.

Physicists.name: Gottfried W. Leibniz
Physicists.desc: A polymath with significant contributions in many fields. Credited alongside Newton with the creation of calculus. Anticipated the relational nature of space and time.

Physicists.name: Nikola Tesla
Physicists.desc: Known for his work on electricity and engineering. Pioneered the use of alternating-current (AC) electricity. Explored the possibility of wireless communication.

Physicists.name: Hendrik Lorentz
Physicists.desc: Provided a theoretical explanation of the Zeeman effect. Derived the Lorentz transformation of the special theory of relativity, as well as the Lorentz force.

Physicists.name: Paul Dirac
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the founders of quantum mechanics, his work on quantum electrodynamics, and the Dirac equation.

Physicists.name: Roger Penrose
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to mathematical physics. Helped develop the Penrose-Hawking singularity theorems. Won the 2020 Nobel Prize in Physics.

Physicists.name: Erwin Schrödinger
Physicists.desc: Known for his many contributions to quantum theory, including the Schrödinger equation, quantum entanglement, and of course, the half-dead cat.

Physicists.name: Sir George Stokes
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to fluid mechanics and physical optics, including polarization and fluorescence. Influenced the later Navier-Stokes equations.

Physicists.name: Peter Shor
Physicists.desc: Best known for his work on quantum computation and information theory. Discovered Shor's algorithm and developed the Shor code for quantum error correction.

Physicists.name: Ernest Rutherford
Physicists.desc: Known for his pioneering work on atomic and nuclear physics. Discovered the concept of radioactive half-life. Differentiated and named alpha and beta radiation.

Physicists.name: Michael Faraday
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to electricity and magnetism. Established the concept of the electromagnetic field. Discovered the principle of electromagnetic induction.

Physicists.name: Enrico Fermi
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to statistical mechanics, nuclear physics, and particle physics. Led the team that demostrated the first human-made nuclear chain reaction.

Physicists.name: Niels Bohr
Physicists.desc: Known for the Bohr model of the atoms, and as one of the founders of quantum theory. Worked to promote international scientific research.

Physicists.name: James Chadwick
Physicists.desc: Known for his discovery of the neutron, for which he received the 1935 Nobel Prize in Physics. Led the British team that worked on the Manhattan Project.

Physicists.name: Llewellyn Hilleth Thomas
Physicists.desc: Contributed to atomic and solid-state physics. Calculated the Thomas precession and developed the Thomas-Fermi theory for N-body quantum systems.

Physicists.name: Marie Curie
Physicists.desc: Pioneered the theory of radioactivity, and discovered the elements polonium and radium. First woman to win the Nobel prize and first person to win the Nobel prize twice.

Physicists.name: Arnold Sommerfeld
Physicists.desc: Pioneered developments in atomic and quantum physics. Introduced the fine-structure constant and the 2nd & 3rd quantum numbers. Mentored several accomplished physicists.

Physicists.name: Werner Heisenberg
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the pioneers of quantum theory. Developed the matrix formulation of quantum mechanics with M. Born and P. Jordan. Discovered the uncertainty principle.

Physicists.name: Max Born
Physicists.desc: Helped create the matrix mechanics representation, and formulated the standard interpretation of the probability density function in the Schrödinger equation.

Physicists.name: Sir J. J. Thomson
Physicists.desc: Discovered the electron, the first subatomic particle to be found. Credited with the first evidence for isotopes. Also a teacher to many high-achieving scientists.

Physicists.name: John von Neumann
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to mathematics, physics, and computer science. Established the first rigorous mathematical framework for quantum mechanics.
